description:
Hoozuki is the aide to the great king of Hell, King Enma. Calm and super-sadistic, Hoozuki tries to resolve the various problems in Hell, including a rampaging Momotarou and his companions. However, he also likes spending his free time on his hobbies, such as fawning over cute animals and raising "Goldfish Flowers."

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uesaka_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uesaka_sumire) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/uesakasumire) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/uesaka_sumire/) | [Record Label Profile](http://king-cr.jp/artist/uesakasumire/)

Sumire entered the entertainment industry at the age of 9, when she was scouted by Space Craft's junior talent division. In 2009, she landed her first regular radio gig as host of Web Raji@Dengeki Bunko, and in 2011, she transferred to animation division of Space Craft due her interest in becoming a voice actress. On March 12, 2016, Sumire received the Best Rookie Actress award in the 10th Seiyuu Awards. She has also been a member of the seiyuu unit ".lady." since 2014.

Sumire is fluent in Russian and loves the Soviet culture, which she became interested in after hearing the State Anthem of the USSR in her first year of high school. In April 2010, Sumire entered the Faculty of Foreign Studies at Sophia University, and she majored in the Russian language there.

Sumire is interested in history and war figurines, particularly Russian/Soviet history, the Showa era, and likes the book Romance of the Three Kingdoms. She also has had a strong interest in games, anime and manga ever since she was a child. Her other interests consists of photography, lolita fashion-- she works as a lolita model-- and drawing, which she is quite good at. She also loves rock and heavy metal; her favorite bands are Metallica, Judas Priest, Black Sabbath, Dragonforce, and Kinniku Shoujo Tai. Additionally, Sumire is very good friends with fellow seiyuu [Sachika Misawa](https://anilist.co/staff/102337/Sachika-Misawa), who has called Sumire "her waifu".

**Non-anime roles:**
- Rosalie - Memento Mori (VG)
- Exia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Drake - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takuopa)__

**Takuya Matsushita** is a Japanese animation planner and producer.
__Date of Birth:__ 1984-01-14

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gonakanishi)

Gou Nakanishi graduated with a degree from Waseda University's Faculty of Letter's, Arts and Sciences. Starting his career with King Records in 1997, he has been instrumental in developing popular artistes and anime hits such as Sokyuu no Fafner, Inukami and Negima!? He is also the producer of the hit Japanese pop band, angela.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/285645051)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

Hiroo Maruyama is a producer working for Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS).

He joined Mainichi Broadcasting in 1999. Was transferred later to the Tokyo office and took over duties relating to the production of animation broadcasts. He was responsible for production on series like Gundam Seed, Gundam Seed Destiny and Full Metal Alchemist, all part of the 6:00pm Saturday timeblock, which gained wide popularity.
__Ryuu Hashimoto__ is a Japanese producer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gwada_wit)

President of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Co-founder and representative director of [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
Tomisiro (stylized TOMISIRO) is a Japanese music production group consisting of Naoyuki Honzawa and Yoske Kakegawa.
Rie Shimasue is a producer and publicity manager.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tk_mogi)

Color designer who works frequently with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures).

Affiliated with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/200070/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鏑木ひろ)

Originating from [Nippon Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/22/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鏑木ひろ)

Originating from [Nippon Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/22/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/naganuma_2022)

Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - "Making or Breaking Hell" and "The Discovery of Hell's Mysteries"
Episode 2 - "Demons and Underwear and Crabs" and "The State of Hell, and This and That"
Episode 3 - "Hakutaku" and "How their discord came to be"
Episode 4 - "Pretty boys need love too" and "Kajika Hell"
Episode 5 - "The Instrumental Duo of the Mighty Rivals" and "Mental Sports Day"

Episode 8 - "The Vulgar Battle" and "The 36 Views of Hell"

Episode 13 - "Hell's Bon Festival of Lights" and "Idle Chat with the Great King Enma"
